document_title: Fibrocystic breast changes: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_name: thay-doi-soi-boc-tuyen-vu.json_6_What should you eat if you have fibrous changes in your mammary glands?
subsection_content:
Vitamins and nutritional supplements can reduce symptoms of breast pain and discomfort in some people. However, patients should ask their doctor before using to choose a suitable product that is effective in treatment.
Evening primrose essential oil.; Vitamin E: taking 200 units (IU) of vitamin E twice daily for 2 months will help improve symptoms. There were no additional benefits after 4 months. For women over 18 years old, pregnant and breastfeeding, the maximum dose of vitamin E is 1,000 mg per day (or 1,500 IU).
Patients should stop taking it if their breast pain does not improve after a few months. Try only one supplement at a time to clearly determine which one provides pain relief.
